SEARCH
Package HumanObject.Patient

Class Patient

java.lang.Object
HumanObject.BasePerson
HumanObject.Patient.Patient
public class Patient extends BasePerson
Represents a patient in a hospital management system, storing personal details, medical history, and appointment records.

This class handles the management of a patient's medical records, appointments, and prescriptions. It includes methods for printing medical records, accessing personal information, and managing appointments (pending, ongoing, and completed).

The patient class extends BasePerson and adds additional attributes related to the patient's health and medical interactions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Patient

      public Patient(int ID, String Name, Date DOB, Boolean Gender, String bloodType, Contact contact)
      Constructs a new Patient object with the specified name, date of birth, gender, blood type, and contact information. This constructor automatically assigns a unique ID by incrementing lastID, ensuring each patient has a distinct identifier.

      This version of the constructor is used to initialize a Patient object from a record stored in the text file HMS.txt. The role is set to ROLE.PATIENT.

      Parameters:
      ID - The ID of the patient.
      Name - The name of the patient.
      DOB - The date of birth of the patient.
      Gender - The gender of the patient, where true represents male and false represents female.
      bloodType - The blood type of the patient (e.g., "A+", "O-", "AB+").
      contact - The Contact information associated with the patient.

      This constructor also initializes the following:

      • Pending - An AppointmentList object for managing pending appointments, initialized to an empty list.
      • Ongoing - An AppointmentList object for managing ongoing appointments, initialized to an empty list.
      • Completed - An AppointmentList object for managing completed appointments, initialized to an empty list.
      • Medicine - A PrescriptionList object for managing the patient's prescriptions.

    • Patient

      public Patient(String Name, Date DOB, Boolean Gender, String bloodType, Contact contact)
      Constructs a new Patient object with the specified name, date of birth, gender, blood type, and contact information. This constructor automatically assigns a unique ID by incrementing lastID, ensuring each patient has a distinct identifier.

      This version of the constructor is used when creating new Patient objects that will be added to the text file HMS.txt. The role is set to ROLE.PATIENT.

      Parameters:
      Name - The name of the patient.
      DOB - The date of birth of the patient.
      Gender - The gender of the patient, where true represents male and false represents female.
      bloodType - The blood type of the patient (e.g., "A+", "O-", "AB+").
      contact - The Contact information associated with the patient.

      This constructor also initializes the following internal lists:

      • Pending - An AppointmentList for managing pending appointments, initialized to an empty list.
      • Ongoing - An AppointmentList for managing ongoing appointments, initialized to an empty list.
      • Completed - An AppointmentList for managing completed appointments, initialized to an empty list.
      • Medicine - A PrescriptionList for managing the patient's prescriptions, initialized to an empty list.

  • Method Details

    • printMedicalRecord

      public void printMedicalRecord()
      Prints the medical record of a patient, displaying relevant patient details. This includes the patient's ID, name, gender, date of birth, contact number, email, blood type, and completion status.

      The patient's gender is displayed as "Male" if gender is true, otherwise it is displayed as "Female". The completion status is printed by calling the print method on the Completed object with a true parameter, which indicates detailed printing of the completion status.

      This method does not return any values and outputs all information to the standard output stream.

      See Also:
      • for retrieving the patient's ID
      • for retrieving the patient's name
      • for retrieving the patient's date of birth
      • for retrieving the patient's blood type
      • for retrieving the patient's contact number
      • for retrieving the patient's email address
      • for printing the completion status in the AppointmentList class
